description: grease pots were installed on the waste lift stations the majority of them have started to slowly leak inside the pump frame, would you be able to send someone over to look at the cause and see if there’s an easy fix as soon as possible as the problem is only going to get worse the longer we leave it obviously. I have attached photo’s for reference. I’m not sure if this would fall under an ESI issue as I can’t remember if they were the ones that fitted the grease pots?

I have attached photo’s for reference. I’m not sure if this would fall under an ESI issue as I can’t remember if they were the ones that fitted the grease pots?

description:
The fuses in the 2 hatches in Central Gardens keep tripping off thereby making the area very dark and unsafe at night. Could you please confirm that Ken Stainless installed the DB? If so could you please send an electrician and investigate the cause of the issue? If Kent Stainless did not install the DB would you know who did it please?

I also have some concerns that the water is penetrating the hatch – see attached pictures – could you please advise if the seal need to be changed?
3:
The fuses in the 2 hatches in Central Gardens keep tripping off thereby making the area very dark and unsafe at night. Could you please confirm that Ken Stainless installed the DB? If so could you please send an electrician and investigate the cause of the issue? If Kent Stainless did not install the DB would you know who did it please?

I also have some concerns that the water is penetrating the hatch – see attached pictures – could you please advise if the seal need to be changed?

description: The caps on these retention sockets are rattling in the socket when traffic passes over them. The contractor has said that they have re-tightened these caps a number of times but that the rattling recommences after a short period of time. Have Kent encountered this issue before and is there anything that could be proposed to prevent this rattling issue? What springs to mind for me is some sort of silicone or rubber insert to absorb to noise however I’m not sure if this is practicable.
3: The caps on these retention sockets are rattling in the socket when traffic passes over them. The contractor has said that they have re-tightened these caps a number of times but that the rattling recommences after a short period of time. Have Kent encountered this issue before and is there anything that could be proposed to prevent this rattling issue? What springs to mind for me is some sort of silicone or rubber insert to absorb to noise however I’m not sure if this is practicable.

description:
Further to the inspection of the hatches on the north park and our discussion. It has been identified that there is a failure of the closing mechanism on the installed north park hatches . See the attached photos and video.
In one instance it has been reported that the hatch opened whilst a member off the public walked over it . I have check 4 hatches and all the locking mechanisms are loose and turn if you stand on the them and twist your foot.
1 hatch cant close as the welds for the closing mechanism have sheared away . hence the picture of a plant pot holding it down.
The other hatches I checked have the closing mechanism loose and the only reason I can see for them not opening with the aid off the damper arms is the seem to be wedged, with the hatch frames now not aligning.
3:
Further to the inspection of the hatches on the north park and our discussion. It has been identified that there is a failure of the closing mechanism on the installed north park hatches . See the attached photos and video.
In one instance it has been reported that the hatch opened whilst a member off the public walked over it . I have check 4 hatches and all the locking mechanisms are loose and turn if you stand on the them and twist your foot.
1 hatch cant close as the welds for the closing mechanism have sheared away . hence the picture of a plant pot holding it down.
The other hatches I checked have the closing mechanism loose and the only reason I can see for them not opening with the aid off the damper arms is the seem to be wedged, with the hatch frames now not aligning.
